Likaså har du en vana att samverka med externa leverantörer och att arbeta nära både teknik, verksamhet och ledning. Din förståelse för informationssäkerhet är god där du känner till regelverk som DORA och ISO/IEC 27002. Ett grundkrav för rollen är att du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från bank/försäkringssektorn och certifiering inom SAFe eller ITIL.
   

  

 Du är driven och målinriktad person som tar initiativ och arbetar strukturerat. Din kommunikativa förmåga är viktig i rollen där samarbete både med interna och externa intressenter är betydande.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Alexander Larre på alexander.larre@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquistion Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Channel Systems Engineer - Nordics
description:
**Company Description**
 Arista Networks is an industry leader in data-driven, client-to-cloud networking for large data center, campus and routing environments. What sets us apart is our relentless pursuit of innovation. We leverage the latest advancements in cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and software-defined networking to provide our clients with a competitive edge in an increasingly interconnected world. Our solutions are designed to not only meet the current demands of the digital landscape but to also anticipate and adapt to future challenges.
   

  

 At Arista we value the diversity of thought and perspectives that each employee brings to the table. We believe that fostering an inclusive environment, where individuals from various backgrounds and experiences feel welcome, is essential for driving creativity and innovation.
   

  

 Our commitment to excellence has earned us several prestigious awards, such as Best Engineering Team, Best Company for Diversity, Compensation, and Work-Life Balance. At Arista, we take pride in our track record of success and strive to maintain the highest standards of quality and performance in everything we do.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Who You'll Work With**
 We are looking for an entrepreneurial Channel Presales Engineer to be focused on creating and growing the Channel business within our growing organisation in the Nordic region with regular travel regularly to our regional partners within the territory, Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland.
   

  

 We're looking for somebody based in either Denmark or Sweden.
   

  

 If you thrive in a fast moving, results-oriented, and rewarding environment, take a closer look at Arista Networks.
   

  

 Ideally you will have a technical background in networking and exposure to Data Center, Campus and Wi-Fi networking technologies - Arista, Cisco, Juniper, Extreme etc. Maybe you are currently a Technical Account Manager or Sales Engineer in a networking vendor or partner organisation. Ideally you will have a background in Pre-Sales Engineering and will be well versed in networking technologies.
   

  

 This role requires an individual who is a self-starter and can demonstrate sales leadership skills, deep technical skills and delivering training and product focus to partners. The candidate will also need to develop an extended eco-system of technology and business partners as well as target and attend industry events to drive lead generation as well as running webinars with regular cadence to better connect with and build relationships with partners.
   

  

 Key to the candidate’s success will be their ability to identify and qualify opportunities and RFPs and executing an engagement plan which creates pipeline opportunities across Arista’s entire portfolio. There is a clear expectation that the candidate will have an appreciation of technology and be able to translate customer priorities into Arista’s differentiated solutions.
   

  

 Join a team which is driving the transformation to Software Defined Cloud Networking via automated solutions to a named list of Enterprise accounts.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Exceed measurable sales objectives and extend the Arista brand within the channel
* You will be responsible for utilising a consultative selling approach with key partners to address the business needs of hybrid cloud computing and siloed legacy IT systems across the Arista product portfolio.
* Qualifying new opportunities and delivering sales presentations and RFPs.
* Meet with key decision-makers to present Arista’s value proposition.
* Partner with the Nordic Systems Engineering team to design and position compelling solutions that drive down the total cost of ownership
* Collaborate with channel partners to identify prospects and demonstrate best-in-class solutions; be willing and able to build a strong relationship and drive joint pipeline building activities with key partners within the Territory.
* Conduct demand generation activities such as happy hours, lunch-n-learns, webinars and technology forums; Able to direct, build, and manage a demand creation campaign for the Territory encompassing all aspects of marketing, PR and all aspects of pipeline creation.
* Collaborate with Arista peers on marketing plans and best practices.
* Keep up-to-date with technology partner solutions, competing solutions and competitor strategies.
* Articulate in communicating the steps and dependencies to closure, while managing expectations via accurate Forecasting/ reporting and open communication within Arista, Channel, and Eco / Business partners.


**Qualifications**
* A minimum of 5 years of commercial or technical experience with a working knowledge of selling networking equipment (Router, Switch, SDN, SD-WAN, Campus Networks, Network Virtualization, NFV), data centre, and/or network automation solutions are prerequisites.
* Fluent in speaking Swedish, Danish or Norwegian. Finnish is optional. Fluency in English also is essential.
* Proven track record of pursuing and closing deals with partners or end customers.
* Currently resident in either Sweden or Denmark - we do not offer relocation. This is a home working / field based role to meet customers.
* Bachelor Degree or equivalent in Computer Science / Networking. MBA desirable.
* Demonstrated people skills and ability to cultivate and maintain relationships at all levels.
* Proven track record of building business plans, documenting the processes, and exceeding sales targets.
* Ability to travel regularly to our regional partners within the territory, Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland.

title: Lösningsarkitekt nätverk
description:
**Att jobba som lösningsarkitekt nätverk**
 I rollen som lösningsarkitekt nätverk kliver du in som en central del av vår arkitekturförmåga, med det operativa och strategiska ansvaret för att forma samt styra utvecklingen av vår datakommunikationsplattform inom Skandias IT- infrastruktur. Ditt uppdrag är att ta helhetsansvar för lösningarna inom nätverk och säkerställa att de är i linje med vår IT-strategi och målarkitektur. Du leder analyser i tidiga faser, definierar riktning, hanterar beroenden och bryter ner behov i epics och features.
   

  

 Rollen innebär att du även arbetar med design, utveckling och styrning av nätverkslösningar som stödjer både verksamhetens behov och framtida teknikutveckling.
   

  

 I rollen ingår ansvar för flera teknikområden:
   

  

* Nätverk (LAN, WAN, WLAN, SD-WAN)
* Säkerhet (brandväggar, segmentering, Zero Trust)
* Moln & fjärråtkomst (Azure, MSP, VPN)
* Trafikstyrning (lastbalansering, proxy)
* Adresshantering (DNS, DHCP, IPAM)
* Automation (SDN och relaterade teknologier)


 Teamet du kommer tillhöra består av ett tiotal specialister som arbetar med Skandias applikations- och infrastrukturstöd. Gruppen ansvarar för utveckling, förvaltning och 3:e nivåsupport av infrastrukturnära plattformar. Vi sitter tillsammans i våra lokaler i Stockholm. Vår arbetskultur kännetecknas av kunskapsutbyte och ett teknikintresse där teamsamarbete står i fokus.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till IT-gruppchef applikation- och infrastruktur.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi söker dig som har några års erfarenhet av att arbeta som lösningsarkitekt, gärna inom nätverk eller infrastruktur. Du har en solid teknisk grund att stå på och trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och verksamhet. Du har djup förståelse för nätverksarkitektur och säkerhetslösningar där du driver lösningar från idé till implementering. Ett grundkrav i rollen är att du behärskar svenska flytande både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Som person är du strukturerad, prestigelös och trygg i din kommunikation. Du har lätt för att samarbeta med andra specialister och ta diskussioner kopplat till det strategiska arbetet.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Alexander Larre på alexander.larre@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquistion Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Senior Vice President, Nordic Head of Enterprise Sales
description:
*Are you ready to take on one of the most senior and impactful sales leadership roles in the Nordics? As our new
 **Senior Vice President, Nordic Head of Enterprise Sales** 
 , you’ll shape GlobalConnect’s future in the enterprise market. This is your opportunity to lead at scale, continue the positive development of our uniformed sales culture, and strengthen partnerships with some of the region’s most influential companies.*
**About Your Role**
 As our new SVP, Nordic Head of Enterprise Sales, you will spearhead our overall
 **enterprise sales strategy across the Nordics.** 
 This is a strategic role with a
 **clear mandate:** 
 set the commercial direction, unify local approaches, and strengthen our position as the trusted digital infrastructure partner for the region’s largest companies.
   

  

 Working through local enterprise sales leaders and covering more than a hundred employees in the Nordics, you’ll ensure markets are aligned and that commercial priorities are transparent and structured. You’ll guide how we segment, plan, and allocate resources, while making sure that we present one strong, unified voice to the market. In the intersection between leadership, sales, and commercial realities, you will lead the continued efforts to grow the business!
   

  

**This is what you will be doing most of the days:**
* Execute and optimize a Pan-Nordic enterprise sales strategy focused on continued growth, customer acquisition, and retention.
* Lead and inspire local sales teams, instilling a culture of energy, collaboration, and accountability.
* Collaborate with important stakeholders across products, delivery, operations, and commercial while staying agile to market dynamics and opportunities.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with enterprise customers, ensuring long-term loyalty and success, and partake in important and business critical client engagements and negotiations to ensure senior leadership buy-in and commitment.


**WHY you should join us**
 At GlobalConnect, you’ll join a
 **fast-growing leader in telecom and digital infrastructure** 
 . You’ll work across diverse Nordic markets, delivering impact at scale, shaping customer experiences, and building high-performing teams. If you thrive on combining strategic leadership with hands-on execution, this role is for you.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for a senior commercial leader who combines
 **strategic vision with hands-on execution** 
 . You are skilled at designing and optimizing a Pan-Nordic sales strategy that drives acquisition, expansion, and retention, while setting ambitious growth targets and using market insights to stay ahead of competitors. You bring a proven ability to build and nurture
 **high-performing sales cultures** 
 across multiple countries, inspiring teams with energy, collaboration, and accountability, while also leading by example through deal shaping, sales coaching, and direct customer engagement.
   

  

 As a leader, you know how to
 **develop and mentor teams** 
 , instilling ownership and urgency, and creating an environment where people thrive, grow, and consistently exceed expectations. You are highly customer-centric, cultivating strong relationships with enterprise clients and acting as their trusted advisor, ensuring our solutions are positioned as critical to their success. At the same time, you bring operational discipline: driving forecasting accuracy, segmentation, territory alignment, and governance, while partnering with Finance and Sales Excellence to ensure
 **sustainable growth** 
 .
   

  

 Above all, you are passionate about
 **building a winning enterprise sales engine for the Nordics** 
 , with the ability to translate vision into measurable goals and results.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* 15+ years in senior sales leadership, preferably in telecom, ICT, or digital infrastructure, with Pan-Nordic or international experience where you have gained a deep understanding of Enterprise customer needs, trends, and ambitions for the future.
* A proven ability to build results-driven sales teams across the Nordics inspiring, developing, and leading high-performance sales teams across geographies and cultures.
* Strong execution focus with a track record of exceeding ambitious targets.
* Excellent communication skills in English and at least one Nordic language.
* Outstanding communication and people skills, with cultural sensitivity, negotiation expertise, and proven success in C-level stakeholder management.


 If you’re excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, don’t worry! We’d still love to hear from you. You are more than welcome to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Partner Davide Sanguini if you have any questions.
   

  

**The application deadline is Thursday the 17th of September.**
 The role can be based in either
 **Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen** 
 . Regular
 **travel across the Nordics** 
 is part of the job.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Trainee, Digital Marketing Activation, Scandinavia
description:
At Fiskars Group we are unified and driven by our common purpose: pioneering design to make the everyday extraordinary. Join our team and seize the extraordinary opportunity to influence the everyday!
   

  

**BA FISKARS (Fiskars & Gerber brands)**
**Trainee, Digital Marketing Activation Scandinavia**
**OUR ROLE**
 At Fiskars Group, we believe in making the everyday extraordinary. Rooted in a heritage dating back to 1649, we are home to design-led lifestyle brands such as Fiskars, Gerber, Iittala, Royal Copenhagen, Waterford, Wedgwood, and more. We’re looking for a curious and creative Trainee in Digital Marketing Activation to join our team in Scandinavia. This is your opportunity to dive into the world of brand activations and influencer collaborations while learning the ropes of consumer marketing in a dynamic, international environment.
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden and reports to Rebecka Shipman, Marketing Activation Manager. The role is a traineeship 6 months fixed-term with a hybrid working model (Tuesdays and Thursdays in-office).
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Fiskars**
**Responsibilities:**
 As part of our Marketing Activation team, you’ll collaborate closely with Sales, Brand & Communications across Scandinavia to execute compelling campaigns. Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Supporting brand activation campaigns and events from ideation to execution.
* Assisting in the creation and coordination of digital promotional materials and briefs.
* Preparing seasonal updates on retailer platforms to keep our digital presence fresh.
* Initiating and maintaining influencer partnerships across Sweden, Norway, and Denmark.
* Managing campaign logistics and communications with vendors and collaborators.
* Creating a social media collaboration calendar, ensuring timely and budget-aligned execution.
* Performing administrative tasks related to budgeting, reporting, and coordination.
* Contributing to team brainstorming and planning sessions to drive marketing impact.


**Who You Are**
**Experience:**
 You’re a recent graduate or final-year student in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field. You bring a blend of passion and precision, ready to take initiative and immerse yourself in a learning-rich environment.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who is:
   

  

* Passionate about branding, consumer behavior, and creative storytelling.
* Highly organized with an eye for detail.
* Eager to grow and take ownership in a fast-paced, collaborative team.
* Fluent in Swedish and English (Danish is a plus).
* Comfortable working across digital tools such as MS Office and Adobe Creative Suite.
* Ideally experienced with social media and/or prior internships or project experience in marketing is advantageous but not mandatory.
* Sociable, trend-aware, and excited to work with external partners.


**What We Offer**
**Creating Change – Celebrating the Everyday – Growing with Compassion**
* Our goal is to make the everyday extraordinary.
* We offer our employees the opportunity to express their creativity and help shape our shared world.
* An exciting range of responsibilities in an innovative, international, and modern working environment.
* An open corporate culture with flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes, and a highly motivated, friendly team.
* Participation in internal meetings, trainings, and workshops as well as close supervision during your studies with direct feedback and coaching.
* Hybrid working model.


**START YOUR JOURNEY AT FISKARS and** 
**become part of our team**
 Did we inspire you? Then we look forward to getting to know you! We are eagerly awaiting your application. We review applications on a continuous basis.
   

  

 Your application documents should include:
   

  

* Motivation letter (why Fiskars?)
* CV
* Certificates of internships, part-time jobs, and/or other qualifications


 We are committed to protecting your personal data, so we only accept applications through our career website.
   

  

**Last day of application:**
 2025-09-16
   

  

 At Fiskars, we value providing benefits that matter to you and cater to our diverse global workforce, no matter where you are in the world. While benefits may vary based on location, here are some of the incredible offerings you can expect when joining our team:
   

  

**Competitive Compensation:** 
 We ensure that our employees are fairly compensated based on industry standards and local market factors.
   

  

**Collective Agreement:** 
 We believe in setting the right standards when it comes to working conditions, we are therefore bounded by collective agreements that ensure a good pension plan, occupational and health insurance, parental leave and vacation days to mention some.
   

  

**Health and Wellness:** 
 Your well-being matters to us and we want to help you achieve it. We offer a well-being allowance (Friskvårdsbidrag) that covers wellness-related costs up to 4000 SEK per year.
   

  

**Work-Life Balance:** 
 We understand the need for balance in your life. Our paid time off plans and flexible work arrangements and policies are designed to accommodate local customs and personal commitments, enabling you to thrive in both your professional and personal life. We currently offer hybrid work arrangements where possible.
   

  

**Professional Development:** 
 We believe in nurturing talent and supporting professional growth. Through training programs, skill development initiatives, and learning resources, we empower our employees to reach their full potential.
   

  

**Inclusive and Diverse Environment:** 
 We celebrate diversity and foster an inclusive culture across all our markets. Our commitment to creating an environment where everyone feels welcome and respected remains consistent, regardless of location.
   

  

**Recognition and Rewards:** 
 We believe in celebrating and recognizing the contributions of our employees worldwide. Our recognition programs are designed to acknowledge exceptional performance and achievements, ensuring that your efforts are celebrated and valued.
   

  

**Vested Interest:** 
 Through our Employee Share Purchase Plan (ESPP), you have the opportunity to invest in Fiskars Group and become a proud co-owner, sharing in the success and growth of the company.
   

  

**Employee Discounts:** 
 We want to ensure our team members make each day extraordinary with use of our products and offer product discounts across our brands.
   

  

*Please note that specific benefits may vary based on local regulations, market conditions, and other factors. We are committed to providing competitive and meaningful benefits to our employees in every market we operate.*
***Pioneering design to make the everyday extraordinary***
*Fiskars Group (FSKRS, Nasdaq Helsinki) is the global home of design-driven brands for indoor and outdoor living. Since 1649, we have designed products of timeless, purposeful, and functional beauty, while driving innovation and sustainable growth. In 2024, Fiskars Group’s global net sales were EUR 1.2 billion and we had close to 7,000 employees. We have two Business Areas (BA), Vita and Fiskars.*
*BA Vita offers premium and luxury products for the tableware, drinkware, jewelry and interior categories. Its well-known brands include Georg Jensen, Royal Copenhagen, Wedgwood, Moomin Arabia, Iittala and Waterford. In 2024, BA Vita’s reported net sales were EUR 605 million. Already 50% of BA Vita’s net sales comes from direct-to-consumer sales, comprising approximately 500 stores and approximately 60 e-commerce sites.*
*BA Fiskars consists of the gardening and outdoor categories, in addition to the scissors and creating, as well as cooking categories. The brands include Fiskars and Gerber. In 2024, BA Fiskars’ net sales were EUR 547 million.*
*Read more: fiskarsgroup.com*
 OBR1

title: Specialistsäljare - Microsoft Security
description:
Ta chansen och var med på vår tillväxtresa. Hos oss får du arbeta med världsledande teknologier från Microsoft i ett framgångsrikt säljteam.
   

  

 Just nu söker vi dig som vill arbeta som specialistsäljare av säkerhetslösningar från Microsoft. Du kommer vara anställd i det nationella Microsoft-teamet inom Atea Software Cloud och Services, men rollen innebär även ett nära samarbete med andra avdelningar inom Atea, så som vårt nationella säkerhetsteam, våra olika affärsområden och våra regioner.
   

  

 Hos Atea får du möjlighet att växa både professionellt och som människa. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som präglas av medarbetare som brinner för att bygga Sverige med IT, tar personligt ansvar och sätter laget före jaget. Vi kallar oss stolt för landslaget i informationsteknologi.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med försäljning av Ateas och Microsofts erbjudanden runt säkerhet. Fokus för arbetet är att utveckla och växa Ateas Microsoft Security affär med tillhörande mervärdestjänster från Atea. Du ansvarar här för säljande och affärsstödjande aktiviteter kopplat till affären. Detta tillsammans med kollegor, leverantör och kunder. I rollen kommer du ha resultatansvar avseende försäljning av Microsoft säkerhetsprodukter inom Atea.
   

  

 Kunderna finns både inom privat- och offentlig sektor. Till din hjälp har du ett av IT-branschens starkaste varumärken, ett säljteam med kollegor som sätter laget för jaget samt en vältrimmad leveransorganisation.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Agera betrodd rådgivare inom säkerhetsområdet internt såväl som mot slutkund.
* Agera central kontaktperson mellan Atea och Microsoft rörande säkerhetserbjudandet.
* Vara intern kontaktperson för kommersiella frågor rörande Microsofts säkerhetserbjudande och de program som finns kopplade till detta.
* Ansvara för utbildning och informationsspridning rörande Microsofts säkerhetserbjudande internt såväl som externt.
* Vara delaktig i Ateas utveckling av mervärdestjänster inom säkerhetsområdet.
* Representera Microsoft säkerhetserbjudande i Ateas säkerhetsgruppering.
* Identifiera och utveckla resurser i Ateas olika regioner.
* Samarbeta med kollegor i kundteam, med tillverkare och andra affärspartners.
* Äga och följa upp försäljningsmål och KPI:er inom säkerhetsområdet.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper, som också är avgörande för att du ska lyckas i rollen och trivas hos oss. Du är driven i ditt säljarbete och motiveras av att göra affärer och hjälpa våra kunder. Du tar fullt ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och är van att driva dina processer framåt på ett strukturerat och självständigt sätt mot tydliga deadlines och mål. Du är bra på att skapa relationer, ger ett förtroendeingivande intryck och har alltid kundens bästa i fokus. Du söker lösningar på uppkomna problem, gillar utmaningar och fungerar konstruktivt både på egen hand och i grupp.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi även att du:
   

  

* har god kunskap om- och flerårig erfarenhet från arbete i IT-branschen
* tidigare arbetat med Microsoft säkerhetslösningar eller med säkerhetslösningar från någon av de andra stora mjukvarutillverkarna
* har tidigare flerårig erfarenhet av försäljningsarbete
* drivs av att guida dina kunder framåt på deras digitaliseringsresa och att försöka förtjäna förtroendet som deras betrodda rådgivare
* gillar förändring då arbetsuppgifterna skiftar i karaktär och omfattning
* Dokumenterad kunskap om IT-säkerhetslösningar, exempelvis Exam SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals är meriterande


**Om Atea**
 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
   

  

 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Tomas Persson, Sales Manager, via tomas.persson@atea.se . Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
   

  

 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
***Ready to turn vision into a scalable technology reality? At Dustin, you’ll lead enterprise-wide architecture that drives transformation, aligns IT with business goals, and fuels innovation at scale.***
**This is what makes the position as Enterprise Architect unique**
* Lead the design and implementation of scalable, future-ready technology landscapes that drive transformational change.
* Align IT strategies with business goals to ensure seamless integration and maximum impact.
* Play a critical role in strengthening our technology foundation as we expand and innovate.


 The Hiring Manager for the role is
 **Fredrik Åsberg, Director of Digital Strategy & Transformation.** 
 As a leader, he deeply believes in his teams and employees. He values self-awareness and responsibility, and together, we deliver on our promises while supporting each other every step of the way.
   

  

**Your role & influence as an Enterprise Architect**
 Responsibility: You will be given responsibility for driving the technology future of Dustin by proactively developing and maintaining the enterprise architecture across business, data, application, and infrastructure domains.
   

  

*Collaboration:* 
 Together with your team, you take care of ensuring alignment and agility in our technology initiatives. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with business leaders, solution architects, and product teams.
   

  

*Core activities*
* Design & Govern: Develop and maintain enterprise architecture across business, data, application, and infrastructure domains while leading architecture governance and ensuring compliance with best practices.
* Strategic Alignment: Translate business strategies into IT target roadmaps and architectural blueprints, ensuring alignment and agility across teams.
* Drive Innovation: Collaborate with business leaders, solution architects, and product teams, proactively identifying opportunities for optimization, modernization, and innovation.


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. Curious? Our Life at Dustin - Dustin Sweden page has you covered.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who thrives on aligning IT with business goals and driving transformational change, with exceptional communication and leadership skills, and a strategic mindset with the ability to think across both business and technology.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* Full professional proficiency in English with Swedish language skills considered a plus.
* Proven experience (around 10 years) as an Enterprise Architect or in a similar strategic role, with strong knowledge of TOGAF, ArchiMate, or similar frameworks,
* Hands-on experience across multiple technology domains (cloud, integration, data, applications, security).


*Nice to Have:* 
 Experience with AI transformation initiatives, relevant certifications (TOGAF, AWS/Azure), familiarity with agile and DevOps practices, and a background in ERP systems like AX or Dynamics.
   

  

****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Cognitive & Personality Assessment test.
* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma.
* First interview with the Hiring Manager, Fredrik.
* Second interview with other colleagues.
* Final in-person interview with the Hiring Manager, Fredrik and VP, Technology, Rozita.
* Professional References.


***Please note that for this specific job, we don´t provide any relocation or work permit sponsorship support.***
**About**
**Read more about how to become a** 
**Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via e-mail: karishma.sindhu@dustin.com
 **.**

title: Deployment Manager Belgium
description:
Are you passionate about making a sustainable impact in the world of electric transport? Do you thrive in an innovative and entrepreneurial environment? Then you might be the new Deployment Manager Belgium to Erinion!
   

  

 Your Role
   

  

 As a Deployment Manager, you’ll play a crucial role in turning ambitious electrification plans into reality. You’ll take end-to-end ownership of our charging infrastructure projects — from early planning and technical assessments to execution and handover — ensuring that every solution is delivered on time, on budget, and to the highest standard. This is a delivery-focused role where you’ll take full responsibility for coordinating successful project rollout across internal teams and external partners. Whether it’s managing subcontractors, navigating permitting processes, or aligning with grid operators, you’ll be the key link that ensures seamless execution and satisfied customers.
   

  

 Your Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Lead the full deployment process of charging infrastructure projects, from planning to completion.
* Conduct site assessments and advise on feasibility, timelines, and budgeting.
* Drive the selection, contracting, and coordination of subcontractors and vendors.
* Manage permitting processes and ensure design compliance.
* Oversee on-site construction activities and ensure safety, quality, and timeline adherence.
* Maintain ongoing communication with stakeholders, providing clear reporting on progress, cost, and performance.
* Liaise with grid operators when needed to secure power supply and capacity.
* Proactively identify risks or roadblocks and implement solutions to keep projects on track.
* Support the sales team with technical expertise and cost estimates during customer discussions.
* Manage the post-project handover to Service & Operations and Customer Success, with clear documentation handed over for future support.


 Your Profile
   

  

 We’re looking for a Deployment Manager with experience managing infrastructure or construction projects from planning to delivery. You understand how to balance timelines, technical requirements, and stakeholder input to make sure each site isdelivered successfully. The role suits someone who’s structured, customer-focused, and confident managing complex projects with many moving parts.
   

  

  

* 4+ years of experience managing end-to-end construction or infrastructure projects
* Proven ability to coordinate subcontractors, budgets, schedules, and site activities
* Strong communication skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks in parallel
* Confident working independently and solving problems across planning and delivery
* Strong technical and commercial understanding, with a focus on delivering value.
* Fluent in English and Flemish. French is a plus.
* Open to regular travel, averaging around 40%
* Experience in energy, e-mobility, or transport is a strong plus


 Our Business
   

  

 Erinion designs, builds and operates depot and destination charging solutions for heavy-duty vehicles. As part of the Scania Group, we combine the strength of a global transport leader with the agility of a fast-growing company. Our approach focuses on energy eXiciency and optimal utilisation, ensuring that electrification is not only sustainable but also financially and commercially viable for our customers. We support diXerent ways of financing, owning and operating charging sites, so that each customer can find the model that best fits their business. With operations across eight European markets and global expansion underway, we enable transport operators to electrify their fleets with confidence and long-term profitability.
   

  

 Our Offer
   

  

 Join our passionate team and be a driving force in the future of sustainable transportation. At Erinion, you won't just be a part of the change, you'll be pioneering it. We offer a competitive compensation package, alongside unparalleled professional growth opportunities. This is an early-stage company where your ideas are valued, your contributions have a significant impact, and you have the chance to develop and grow alongside Erinion.
   

  

 Further Information and Application
   

  

 We are driven by our belief that the power of diversity fuels innovation. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. We are working with an ongoing selection; please apply as soon as possible if you are interested, but no later than 2025-09-14. Your application should include your CV and certificate of your highest finished degree. Please note that we cannot accept applications over email. If you have any further questions contact Linda Rosenqvist at linda.rosenqvist@scania.com. A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

 **Booker/Sales Manager** 
 who wants to grow with us. Someone passionate about building relationships, driving sales, and being part of shaping the next generation of model management.
