title: systemutveckling och arkitektur
description:
### **Uppdragsbeskrivning**


Vi söker en konsultresurs inom **systemutveckling och arkitektur** till ett förvaltningsuppdrag kopplat till trafikinformation för järnväg. Teamet arbetar med ramverk för modulbaserade **WPF-applikationer** samt webbaserade lösningar som används på plattformsskyltar och i mobila enheter.


Arbetsuppgifterna omfattar bland annat att analysera krav, ta fram lösningsförslag och kostnadsuppskattningar i samarbete med övriga teamet samt att implementera nya och förändrade funktioner. Arbetet bedrivs i nära samarbete med teamledare och kollegor, vilket gör god samarbetsförmåga till en viktig egenskap.


Konsulten ska vara tillgänglig för intervju.

### **Ska-krav**

* Konsult på **kompetensnivå 4 (9–12 års erfarenhet)**
* Minst 9 års erfarenhet av **systemutveckling i C#/.NET**
* Erfarenhet av **infrastruktur inom transportsystem**, exempelvis järnväg och dess olika komponenter
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av **WPF** och **WCF**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av databastekniker som **Dapper** och **Dacpac**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av **apputveckling för Android och iOS**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av **Azure Cloud**
* Nyligen dokumenterad erfarenhet av **mobilanpassade webbapplikationer i PWA**
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både tal och skrift

### **Bör-krav**

* Inga specificerade

### **Referensuppdrag**


Konsulten ska lämna minst ett relevant uppdrag som pågått eller avslutats inom de senaste två åren och som omfattat minst 800 timmar. Uppdraget ska vara jämförbart med detta uppdragsbeskrivning. Följande information ska anges:

* Kundens namn och kontaktuppgifter
* Tidsperiod (från–till)
* Beskrivning av uppdragets omfattning och innehåll

### **Praktisk information**

* **Placeringsort:** Borlänge, med möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 40%
* **Uppdragsperiod:** 2025-10-01 – 2026-09-30, med möjlighet till förlängning 6+6 månader
* **Omfattning:** 100%

 **Om Rasulson Consulting**  

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Interim Digital & Marketing Communications Manager
description:
**Är du en kreativ digital kommunikatör som vill vara med och utveckla** Vecturas varumärke och platsdestinationer över hela Sverige? **Då kan detta vara rollen för dig!**
  

  

*Vectura är ett snabbväxande fastighetsbolag som utvecklar platser där människor och verksamheter kan växa. Nu söker vi en Interim Digital & Marketing Communications Manager som vill vara med och stärka vårt varumärke och våra platsdestinationer över hela Sverige. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där idéer snabbt blir till verklighet och där du blir en nyckelspelare i vår fortsatta tillväxtresa.*


**Vår kultur vilar på tre värderingar som syns i allt vi gör:**
  

Step by step, People first, Better together.
  

  

Vi söker nu en Interim Digital & Marketing Communications Manager till vårt Communication, Marketing and Ecosystem-team. I rollen blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att utveckla och stärka Vecturas varumärke samt våra platsdestinationer runt om i Sverige.  



  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**  

Som Interim Digital & Marketing Communications Manager kommer du att arbeta brett och kreativt med både interna och externa kommunikationskanaler. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:


* Uppdatering och utveckling av våra hemsidor **(**Umbraco)
* Content development och publicering av material i våra digitala plattformar **(Linkedin och** instagram)
* Produktion av presentationsmaterial i **Adobe** Creative Cloud (Photoshop m.fl.)
* Uppdatering och utveckling av interna kommunikationskanaler (Microsoft Teams/SharePoint)
* Hantering av **HubSpot** CRM för events och inbjudningar

**Vem är du?**  

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av digital kommunikation och marknadsföring, gärna med vana att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt. Du är trygg i att producera och publicera innehåll, och har en känsla för både tonalitet och visuell design. Erfarenhet av att arbeta i CMS, sociala medier, samt med verktyg som Adobe Creative Cloud och HubSpot är meriterande.


Du är en initiativtagande person som trivs i en dynamisk miljö där du får möjlighet att arbeta brett, samarbeta med kollegor från olika delar av organisationen och bidra till att stärka Vecturas position på marknaden.


**Vi erbjuder**


* En spännande interimroll i 6 månader, med möjlighet till fast anställning
* Möjlighet att påverka och utveckla Vecturas varumärke och kommunikationsplattformar
* Ett engagerat och kompetent team inom Communication, Marketing and Ecosystem

title: Office Manager
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM**  

Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology gives clarity in complex IT environments, helping every user make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.


We’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.


Together, we build the future of SAM.

 **About the role**  

We’re seeking an organised, proactive and people-focused Office Manager to be the heart of our workplace. You'll be responsible for maintaining an exceptional and welcoming office environment that takes the company's daily operations to the next level.


This is a dynamic, hands-on role that combines office operations, service coordination, purchasing and administrative support. You will act as a central resource for both employees and management.

**Responsibilities**

**Office operations & front desk**

  

* Be present in the office between 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM.
* Welcome employees, visitors, and external guests.
* Act as the first point of contact for all employees.
* Handle deliveries, office supplies, catering, and other daily needs.
* Ensure the office is clean, safe, and comfortable.
* Monitor lighting, climate, and security systems.
* Oversee office equipment and furniture.
* Manage contracts with suppliers and service providers.
* Handle minor procurement and onboard new vendors when needed.
* Coordinate cleaners, maintenance, and other external partners.

**Administrative support**

  

* Manage mail, phone calls, and general correspondence.
* Keep physical and digital documents organised and up to date.
* Support with basic administrative tasks as needed.
* Continuously improve administrative routines and office workflows
  

**Internal events & activities**

* Plan and coordinate internal office events (breakfasts, team gatherings, birthdays, etc.)
* Manage event logistics, including invitations, scheduling, headcounts, and calendars.
* Propose new event ideas in alignment with managers or relevant teams.
* Create content for social media posts.

**Qualif****ications**

  

* Experience in a similar role in a fast-paced environment.
* Warm, professional, and service-oriented mindset - driven to create great experiences.
* Detail-oriented and resourceful, with a strong problem-solving approach.
* Confident in juggling multiple tasks and priorities.
* Proactive and independent, with the ability to take initiatives to improve routines and solve issues.
* Confident using Microsoft 365 and other digital tools.
* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English (spoken and written).

**What you get**

* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.

**Our values at Xensam**

**Rebellious**  

We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.

**Humane**  

We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

**Harmony**  

We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.


As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Infrastructure / Platform Engineer
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a* ***Infrastructure / Platform Engineer*** *to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.*

***Period:*** *ASAP to 2025-12-31 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.*

#### **About the role**


We're looking for a skilled Infrastructure / Platform / Cloud Native contractor to join the Infra PA in Core Infra studio through the end of the year. You will support the team in their Platform mission that is responsible for the Perimeter infrastructure, that owns several pieces of our core infrastructure, the main one being Envoy-based reverse-proxy that receives every external traffic. You will help maintain high standards of reliability, scalability, and automation across our systems.

#### **What you'll do**


You’ll join the Core Infrastructure group within the Infra Product Area, responsible for the cloud-native backbone powering the client's entire backend. The team provide services for container orchestration, observability, reliability, cloud resource and storage management, production networking, and service discovery at multi-million core scale.
  

  

The work is technical, impactful, and core to how all developers deliver features globally. The team you will join focuses on the Network part of it, owning the perimeter system and working on things like LoadBalancers, rate limiting and traffic protection, traffic insights.

  


#### **Who you are**

* 5+ years experience in Infrastructure or Platform Engineering roles
* Experienced backend developer with solid programming/scripting skills (Java, C++, Python, Bash)
* Comfortable with building and operating production infrastructure in a cloud-native environment (Google Cloud Platform preferred)
* Experience in Kubernetes and distributed system design at scale
* Automation and IaC experience (Terraform, Helm, CI/CD pipelines)
* Deep understanding of reliability engineering, performance tuning, and incident response

#### **We are Market Partner**

*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.* *We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.*

title: Channel Sales Executive - Estonia
description:
**Channel Sales Executive - Estonia**
-------------------------------------


We’re looking for a driven Channel Sales Executive to spearhead our growth in Estonia —building our partner network, nurturing key relationships, and driving lasting sales results. As our sole representative in Lithuania on the ground, you’ll enjoy both autonomy and full backing from our Baltic and Nordic teams in Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Finland. With their support and close collaboration, you’ll shape our market presence and make a real impact in the cybersecurity space.

#### **Key Responsibilities️**

* Drive new partner acquisition across Estonia through targeted prospecting, outreach, and cold calling.
* Build and grow a high-impact partner network in Estonia.
* Collaborate with Nimblr’s cross-functional teams to execute our channel growth strategy.
* Manage key partner relationships for long-term mutual success.
* Meet and exceed defined sales KPIs—monthly, quarterly, annual.

#### **What we are looking for**

* Based in Estonia, with a valid driving licence and a willingness to travel nationally
* Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business or a related field
* A minimum of 5 years of experience in B2B SaaS sales, ideally within cybersecurity
* Proven success in a channel or partner sales role with experience in partner onboarding, enablement and a deep understanding of channel sales strategy and operations
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills
* High levels of initiative, independence, and persistence
* Proficient with CRM systems and modern sales tools
* A valid driving license and willingness to travel within Estonia
* Fluent in both Estonian and English (written and spoken).
* Bonus: knowledge of any other Baltic or European language.

#### **What We Offer**

* An energetic, ambitious scale-up culture that thrives on thinking fast and big.
* Flexibility at its core: flexible hours, “Give-Me-A-Break-Day”, wellness hours, and the liberty to work from any Nimblr office across Europe.
* Genuine impact: your initiatives will matter—and your voice will be heard.
* Competitive base salary and an attractive commission structure tailored to reward your performance.
* A culture of growth: continuous opportunities to learn, advance and shape our path

  

  



### **Who are we?**


Nimblr is a fast-growing, cutting-edge cybersecurity company with offices in Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, Portugal and Vietnam. We’re a dynamic team of 60+ employees passionate about making a real impact in the world of Security Awareness. Nimblr offers a cloud-based cyber security training platform, leveraging expertise from IT security, e-learning, and behavioural psychology. Our engaging training equips customers' workforces with the skills and knowledge needed to strengthen their resilience against potential cyber threats.  



  

#### **Ready to join us?**


If you’re ready to bring your experience, drive and independence to help Nimblr thrive in Estonia—and you’re excited about shaping a market where you’ll be the pioneering team member—we want to hear from you. Please submit your application—we’re eager to welcome you aboard.

title: Support Specialist
description:
At Ingrid, we’re on a mission to solve one of the biggest challenges in global e-commerce: creating the world’s best delivery experiences. Since 2015, our SaaS platform has helped merchants improve online shopping for millions of consumers by offering smarter, more flexible delivery options. E-commerce is growing rapidly all over the world, and Ingrid is the key to success. We are in an expansive phase and want to develop our team with new skills. If you are curious to join a fast-paced and agile work environment with high ambition, apply now!
   

  

 Now we’re growing our
 **Customer Love team** 
 and looking for a
 **First Line Support Specialist** 
 who wants to make a real impact on the customer experience.
   

  

**In this role you will :**
* Be the first point of contact for new and existing customers via chat, email and phone.
* Troubleshoot reported issues and solve cases, escalating to second line or product teams when needed.
* Collaborate closely with colleagues across Implementation, Product and Operations.
* Ensure smooth daily operations by monitoring performance and suggesting improvements.
* Jump on calls with customers to guide them until their issue is fully resolved.
* Continuously learn about our platform and share knowledge within the team.


**What we're looking for:**
* Experience working directly with customers (support, service, or sales)
* Fluent in English (Swedish or Polish a plus)
* Strong problem-solving skills and a service-minded, proactive approach
* Curious and collaborative — you enjoy teamwork and a “show me how” mindset
* Ability to investigate complex issues, connect how systems interact, and explain technical concepts clearly
* Drive to continuously learn and improve
* Bonus: experience in e-commerce, logistics, or SaaS support
* Bonus: technical exposure (e.g. REST APIs or coding)
* Bonus: experience writing or maintaining support documentation


**What we offer:**
* A flexible and informal work environment where your ideas matter.
* The opportunity to develop your skills and grow with a fast-scaling company.
* Annual professional development budget.
* Support from experienced and collaborative team members.
* Great teamwork in a highly ambitious startup culture.
* Offices in Stockholm (HQ) and Wroclaw, with hybrid/remote opportunities.


**A Culture You’ll Thrive In:**
* Trust & Growth: A values-driven environment where you're empowered to do meaningful work.
* Embrace Challenges: We see every obstacle as a chance to learn, grow, and innovate.
* Always Improving: Excellence is our standard. We refine constantly, never settle.
* Healthy Balance: Flexible hours, remote options, and generous vacation to support life outside of work.
* Team & Community: From brown bags to team events, we foster connection and authenticity.
* Well-being Support: Wellness allowance for your physical and mental health.
* Future Security: Occupational pension plan for long-term peace of mind.


**Ready to join?**
 We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait – apply today!

title: Senior Data Product Manager
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media and Data Infrastructure and Analytics
description:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Product Manager to shape and drive the development of modern data products that empower smarter decisions and create data-driven experiences for customers. You’ll lead strategy, collaborate across teams, and bring strong product vision to how data is used throughout the business.
 



  





**Must haves:** 



* 5+ years of product management experience, ideally focused on data products, platforms, or internal tooling
* Strong understanding of modern data architecture, pipelines, and tooling (experience with Databricks or Azure is welcome, but not essential)
* Ability to work confidently with senior stakeholders and influence strategic direction
* Proven track record of translating business needs into scalable product solutions
* Skilled in leading technical delivery through prioritisation, structured thinking, and collaboration
* Competence with SQL and reasoning about data models
* Excellent communication skills with a structured approach to problem solving
* Experience working in a distributed, remote-first team environment



  





**Nice to haves:** 



* Familiarity with how data powers machine learning and AI use cases
* Hands-on exposure to data-driven customer features such as recommendations, automation, or predictive workflows
* Knowledge of governance models, tooling choices, and scaling data platforms
* Experience capturing and connecting data from both internal and external sources

title: AI Solutions Engineer
description:
**About Gilion:**
 Our mission is clear: We are accelerating founders in their growth journey through our Gilion platform. As a growing product company leveraging AI, we are creating an innovative, technically challenging platform revolutionizing how businesses grow - with the key of the platform being analytics, unique AI forecasting and equally as important; access to financing and funding, in a way never done before. Watch our platform here: gilion.com/platform
   

  

 Our team is made up of experts who have been part of leading companies like Spotify, Google, King, Sinch, bringing a wealth of experience and a passion for pushing boundaries. At Gilion, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, dynamic environment where your work will have a tangible impact on both our product and the industry as a whole. If you’re excited about working with challenging technology and making a real difference, Gilion is the place for you.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 You’ll bridge the gap between Gilion’s customers and our AI-driven analytics products. You will be building tools and services that make customers’ data accessible to an Analytics platform and AI agents for advanced credit and business analysis. In this role, you’ll also be spending time engaging directly with customers - onboarding them to our platform, ensuring their data quality, and making sure their integration is smooth and scalable as we grow.
   

  

* Lead customer onboarding from a technical perspective - guiding setup, integration, and data mapping and creating scalable solutions.
* Ensure high-quality, structured customer data that meets analysis requirements.
* Use and develop internal tools to clean, transform, and enrich data
* Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to build and improve data transformation tools and semantic layers.
* Work with AI agent orchestration (e.g. develop MCPs) to ensure agents have the right data and context to perform automated analyses.


**Background/Profile:**
* Strong understanding of data processing and integration
* Experience in backend development for building data transformation scripts/services.
* Strong interest in working with AI
* Excellent communication skills - able to explain technical concepts clearly to non-technical customers.
* Self-driven, adaptable, and eager to work in a fast-paced scaleup environment.


**What we offer:**
* Work-life balance, hybrid-remote model
* Diverse, inclusive and knowledge-sharing culture
* Experienced founders, backed by top investors
* A growth journey with tons of development opportunities
* AI product that impacts how companies grow, disrupting the industry

title: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)
description:
What we do at Qliro
   

  

 At Qliro, we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly, and highly competent people who together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both in Sweden and across the Nordics.
   

  

 What your team does
   

  

 As our Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), you will lead the Information Security and Risk Management (ISRM) team. Our mission is to protect Qliro’s assets while ensuring compliance with all legal requirements related to information security, risk management, and privacy. We operate in a fast-moving, agile environment and work closely with teams across Risk, Legal, Compliance, Tech and the broader organization to continuously enhance our security posture. You will report to our Chief Risk Officer.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Manage and coordinate the ISRM team and oversee Qliro’s information security strategy.
* Develop and maintain documentation, processes, and risk management frameworks for InfoSec governance.
* Act as Qliro’s Data Protection Officer (DPO) and ensure ongoing GDPR compliance.
* Lead Business Continuity Management, including impact assessments, continuity planning, and disaster recovery.
* You will be
* Drive education and awareness programs to ensure security and privacy understanding at all levels, from employees to the Board.
* Oversee third-party risk management, including vendor onboarding and annual reviews.
* Act as the main contact for internal and external auditors and facilitate compliance with PCI DSS and GDPR.
* Assess security maturity and report to relevant stakeholders, including Board and executive management.
* Serve as an InfoSec stakeholder in various strategic initiatives, including cloud migration, vendor management, and privacy compliance.
* Lead the InfoSec committee and Privacy Forum, coordinating cross-functional security initiatives.
* Ensure implementation of technical and organizational privacy controls in compliance with GDPR.


 What you bring to the team
   

  

* 3-5 years of experience leading an InfoSec team or holding a senior InfoSec role (CISO or Head of InfoSec).
* Experience in the finance industry, preferably in a regulated environment.
* Strong knowledge of information security frameworks and certifications such as ISO27001, PCI DSS, CISA, or CISSP.
* A background in technology, such as IT auditing, development or IT operations, is highly beneficial.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey security concepts across all levels of the organization.
* Experience implementing security controls in cloud environments is a plus.
* A strategic mindset combined with a hands-on approach to problem-solving.


 WOW in everything we do
   

  

 We work hard to create a workplace that is diverse and inclusive, with employees from over 30 countries worldwide. We believe in the power of collaboration and empowering each other, and we strive to create a WOW experience in everything we do. Our future way of working is hybrid, combining time in the office with remote work. We see our office as a space for collaboration and creativity, where we bring out the best in one another.
   

  

 Does this sound like your next challenge? Apply now and join us on our journey!
   

  

*Qliro is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual* 
 orientation
 *or age.*

title: AWS Public Sector Cloud Architect - Cloud Infrastructure
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience in hands-on cloud enterprise architecture design, storage and networking solutions
* 3+ years of experience in consulting and working with enterprise customers
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of experience in working with enterprise customers in building, migrating and modernizing enterprise applications
* 3+ years of experience with customer cloud transformation activities to ensure successful delivery of solutions


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred and experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python, CDK, shell, Ruby, Powershell)
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Experience with AWS services (e.g. AWS Application Migration Service (MGN), Cloud Migration Factory, Portfolio analysis tooling) and managing large scale data center to data center and/or data center to cloud migrations; data center operations (e.g. data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications)
* Experience integrating AWS AI/ML services (SageMaker, Bedrock, Amazon Q); understanding of AI/ML governance and responsible AI practices


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A3070745

title: Solutions Architect
description:
REQ# FEQ326R131
   

  

 At Databricks, our core principles are at the heart of everything we do; creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential part of this mission, using your technical expertise to demonstrate how our Data Intelligence Platform can help customers solve their complex data challenges. You'll work with a collaborative, customer-focused team who values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create customized solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and guide their businesses forward. Join us in our quest to change how people work with data and make a better world!
   

  

**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft
description:
Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Microsoft Cloud services, where you'll design, implement, and manage cutting-edge Azure solutions, collaborate with talented professionals, and grow your career with personalized development plans and access to top-tier certifications.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft unique**
* Take ownership as a technical Lead in a specialized service area, shaping strategic solutions and driving innovation
* Cutting-Edge Technology Exposure: Work hands-on with Microsoft Cloud technologies like Azure, Power Platform, and DevOps, keeping you at the forefront of industry advancements
* Access personalized career development, Microsoft certifications, and holistic well-being support, ensuring both professional and personal success


 As a Senior Azure Engineer, you will work with delivery projects, maintenance, development, and life cycle management of our Managed Services platforms. The position also includes 3rd line level support, incident handling, change and problem management related to our European Portfolio under Cloud Services e.g. Azure Operate, Azure Migrate, Landing Zone and Azure Ready Assessment.
   

  

 My name is Heidi Storm, Head of Microsoft Cloud Services. As a leader, I am dedicated and transparent, always championing a "Win as a Team" mentality. I believe in fostering a welcoming, supportive, and solution-oriented environment where everyone can grow, collaborate, and make a real impact.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Public Cloud Consultant** 
**Microsoft**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for designing, implementing, and managing scalable cloud architectures using Microsoft Azure, while collaborating with development teams to enhance cloud-based services, automate operations, and ensure optimal performance and reliability.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of delivering our Standardized Services efficiently and effectively. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams to ensure seamless implementation and customer success.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams, to develop, maintain, and successfully deliver customer projects
* Providing 3rd line support by handling incidents, managing changes, and solving complex problems within the European Portfolio to ensure seamless service delivery
* Developing and maintaining internal support tools to optimize workflows, streamline project deployments, and assist consultants in delivering high-quality solutions


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who is passionate about Microsoft cloud technologies, thrives in a collaborative environment, and enjoys solving complex technical challenges to deliver high-quality solutions.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* 5+ years of experience in Microsoft cloud solutions, with a focus on Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and Microsoft server infrastructure
* A strong understanding of Azure services, including Virtual Machines, Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure networking, Azure Backup, and Azure Firewall
* Experience with infrastructure as code utilizing ARM templates/JSON
* Knowledge of identity services like Windows Active Directory, Entra ID, and Entra ID domain services
* Proficient in English, as it is the main language used for all internal and external communications. Additionally, proficiency in one of the local languages spoken in Dustin’s operating countries (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, Dutch, Finnish, or French) is a plus


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with the recruiter Elza van Grootel- Coenraats
* 1st interview with Heidi Storm
* 2nd interview with Technical Lead from the team & Heidi Storm
* 3rd interview with Jonas Sjöberg (Director for Managed Services)


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Elza van Grootel- Coenraats via e-mail

title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
Do you want to work at the heart of digital commerce, building long-term partnerships with some of the Nordic region’s most ambitious retailers, brands and B2B companies? We are looking for a Strategic Account Manager who combines strong commercial drive with strategic insight to nurture existing customer relationships and proactively grow revenue.
 



  





 As a 
 **Strategic Account Manager** 
  at Norce, you will own a portfolio of our most important customers, securing retention and driving Net Revenue Retention (NRR) by identifying growth opportunities and collaborating closely with our solution partners to deliver added value. Your mission is to create value for both the customer and Norce by strengthening relationships, uncovering commercial opportunities, and leading initiatives that generate measurable business impact. You will work closely with senior stakeholders, solution partners, and internal teams to build lasting partnerships and support customers as their needs and ambitions evolve.
 



  





 We believe in building partnerships that last. That means understanding your customers’ business inside and out – their strategy, goals, and challenges – and proactively helping them succeed. Your efforts will directly influence the profitability, retention, and expansion of our customer base.
 



  





**This role suits you if you:** 



* Enjoy combining strategic planning with hands-on business development.
* Are confident engaging and negotiating with senior decision-makers, including C-level executives.
* Can see both the big picture and the details needed to make it happen.
* Thrive when collaborating across teams and with external partners.
* Are motivated by achieving results through a strong business mindset, focused on maximizing customer value and retention.



  





**Experience we believe will help you succeed:** 



* 5+ years of experience in B2B sales, strategic account management, or customer success –preferably within SaaS, technology, or other complex, solution-based industries.
* Proven success managing and growing large strategic accounts, securing long-term partnerships, and driving profitable growth.
* Strong track record in leading contract negotiations and renewals that deliver solid commercial results.
* Experience working within the ecommerce sector and collaborating closely with solution partners to deliver the best possible value to customers.
* Solid technical understanding with the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and with business impact.



  





**Workplace** 
 : You can be based at either our Gothenburg or Stockholm office.
 



  





**About Norce** 




 Norce is the Nordic region’s leading SaaS platform for digital commerce. We empower B2B and B2C companies with powerful technology to accelerate their digital business. Our expertise lies in managing large and complex assortments, optimising pricing & campaigns, and delivering powerful B2B functionality. We meet the most advanced needs for security, flexibility, and scalability through an architecture that is True SaaS, API-first, headless, and composable. Norce Commerce is today trusted by some of the Nordic region’s most successful companies including Adlibris, Blåkläder, Cervera, Royal Design, and Spendrups. Our offices are located in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Oslo where our teams of dedicated experts work with one common objective, creating superior value for our customers and partners. For more information, visit www.norce.io or follow us on LinkedIn.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
**Analytics Engineer**
 Are you passionate about transforming data into insight and impact? Do you thrive at the intersection of analytics, technology, and business? Excited to help shape the future of audio content with reliable and actionable insights? If so, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 As part of our mission at Podme to build joyful and habit-forming listening experiences across the Nordics, we’re looking for a talented Analytics Engineer—with a focus on analytical insight and stakeholder collaboration—to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you’ll work closely with teams across product, marketing, engineering, and beyond, ensuring that our decisions are informed by accurate insights. Your contributions will drive strategic decisions and fuel growth and innovation across our subscription platform.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to make your mark at a fast-growing company where creativity meets data and where podcasts are just the beginning.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Transform and model data to ensure clean, trustworthy, and reusable datasets for reporting and analysis.
* Design and maintain dashboards that track key business, product, and marketing KPIs.
* Collaborate with marketing teams to analyse customer lifecycle data and identify growth opportunities.
* Partner with product and engineering to implement and refine tracking strategies across our platforms.
* Conduct deep-dive analyses to generate insights that shape content and product development.
* Work closely with Data Engineers to set up robust validation checks and resolve data discrepancies proactively.
* Collaborate with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate data needs into actionable solutions.


 What You Bring
   

  

 You’re not just great with data, you know how to make it matter. You love digging into complex data domains, building scalable solutions, and communicating your findings in a way that informs and inspires.
   

  

* Hands-on experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst, or similar role with a focus on analytics and stakeholder collaboration.
* Strong SQL skills and experience working with cloud data warehouses like BigQuery.
* Experience with dbt and modern data transformation practices.
* Ability to build clear, insightful dashboards in tools like Looker Studio (or similar).
* Understanding of data modeling principles and analytics best practices.
* Strong communicator who can turn complex data into actionable stories for a range of stakeholders.
* Bonus: Familiarity with Python, Airflow, Braze, GA4, or experience in subscription-based media or audio platforms.
* Extra kudos: Familiarity with data privacy regulations.


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* A structured thinker who connects data to real-world outcomes.
* A curious mind who asks the right questions and finds answers in the numbers.
* A collaborative communicator who shares insights clearly.
* A problem-solver who blends technical skill with business context.


 Why Join Podme?
   

  

 At Podme, we believe in the power of audio stories to inform, entertain, and inspire. Backed by Schibsted—one of the Nordics’ leading media groups—we’re on a mission to deliver the best of podcasting and beyond to listeners across Sweden, Norway, and Finland.
   

  

* Dynamic Environment: Make an impact at a fast-growing company.
* Supportive Culture: Collaborate with a team that values knowledge-sharing and continuous learning.
* Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy 3-4 days per week in our Stockholm office, balancing flexibility with team connection.
* Wellness Perks: Access healthcare benefits and wellness allowances.
* Premium Content Access: Listen to our exclusive shows–on the house.


 Help us power the Nordic podcast revolution with insight-driven decisions.
   

  

 Your next great challenge starts here.
   

  

 Apply now and let’s build something great together.

title: Senior VMware Konsult
description:
*Vill du arbeta på det högst certifierade företaget inom VMware by Broadcom i norra Europa? Med spetskompetens inom IT och digitalisering möjliggör vi för företag och organisationer att skapa en mer hållbar och framgångsrik verksamhet. Med stor passion för IT och för att sätta kunden i fokus motiverar vi varandra att hela tiden ligga i framkant och vara ledande i branschen.* 




  





**Senior VMware Konsult på Advania 🚀** 




 I rollen som Senior VMware-konsult, inom Real Time Services, samarbetar du med specialister som har spetskompetens inom IT och digitalisering. Du kommer på daglig basis leverera professionella IT-tjänster och lösningar till företag och organisationer. Vi har primärt fokus på produkter från VMware by Broadcom samt det nya bolaget omnissa och vi agerar inom följande områden: Datacenter Virtualization, Automation, Anywhere Workspace, Cloud Native Platform, Networking & Security, Storage & Availability och Project Management.
 



  





 Du ingår i vårt konsultteam där du är en nyckelperson på våra kunders digitala resa. Våra kunder är både mindre och större organisationer och tillsammans är vi med och driver några av Sveriges största privata och hybrida molnprojekt.
 



  





 Som VMware-konsult hos oss kommer du att;
 


* Arbeta med design, implementation, felsökning, förvaltning och utveckling av våra kunders VMwareplattformar och IT-infrastruktur.
* Delta i projekt och uppdrag som teknisk rådgivare och/eller utförare samt leverera dokumentation efter utsatta krav.
* Agera teknisk specialist och rådgivare både internt och mot kund inom ditt/dina kompetensområden.
* Genomföra förstudier, analyser och workshops.
* Stötta arkitekter vid framtagandet av design för VMware-plattformar.
* Stötta sälj vid framtagandet av VMware plattforms-lösningar.
* Utveckla din kompetens genom att omvärldsbevaka och uppdatera dig gällande senaste nytt inom IT.



  





 Vi söker över hela Sverige, med flexibiliteten att kunna arbeta hos och nära våra kunder liksom kontinuerligt sammansluta med kollegorna som du finner i följande städer; Stockholm, Uppsala, Västerås, Örebro, Malmö, Helsingborg, Linköping, Norrköping och Göteborg.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig ✨** 




 Du har väldigt god kännedom om VMware´s produkter och har arbetat med lösningar inom virtualisering av VMware-plattformar, infrastruktur och datacenter. För oss är det viktigt att du är en god ambassadör och uppträder professionellt i ditt uttryck samtidigt som du är lyhörd och lösningsorienterad. Vi söker dig som är genuint nyfiken och har ett intresse att hålla dig uppdaterad inom branschen och IT. Du har förmåga att presentera och diskutera design och teknik med både kunder och kollegor.
 



  





 För att trivas i rollen som konsult tror vi att du är självgående, ansvarsfull och har förmåga att organisera, planera och prioritera dina arbetsuppgifter.
 



  





**Vi förväntar oss att du redan har några av följande erfarenheter;** 



* Certifieringar inom VMware´s mjukvaruutbud (VCP, VCAP, VCIX och liknande) speciellt inom någon av VMware's specialistprodukter (NSX, vRA/vRO, VCF och liknande).
* Certifieringar inom hårdvara (HPE, Dell, Fortinet och liknande).
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft mjukvaruutbud (MCSA, MCSE och liknande).



 Det är extra meriterande om du dessutom har utbildning, certifiering och erfarenhet inom VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF), VMware Cloud Director (VCD), Kubernetes, Tanzu och OpenShift
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋** 




 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
 



 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. En anställning hos oss kan även innebära konsultuppdrag i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
 



  





 Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
 



  





 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor! ☀️

title: Revenue People Partner
description:
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a
 **business-first people leader** 
 to join our Sales & Consulting organization. Our sales team thrives on hustle - cold calls, rejections, pipeline building, and relentless execution. To scale effectively, we need someone who ensures our people strategy is tightly aligned with performance and business outcomes. Your mission is to partner with the Head of Sales, owning the leadership, coaching, and organizational aspects so our leaders can stay focused on customers and growth. This is not HR. It’s about driving a
 **high-performance culture** 
 - ensuring we hire the right people, train them to succeed, hold them accountable, and reward those who deliver.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Run regular 1:1s with team members focused on performance, motivation, and accountability.
* Lead performance reviews and salary reviews, tying compensation directly to results.
* Partner with sales leadership on organizational planning and resource allocation.
* Take ownership of recruiting, bringing in sales and consulting talent who can deliver under pressure.
* Manage sensitive HR matters (discipline, exits, promotions) with a business-first lens.
* Build learning & development programs tailored to sales skills (cold calling, closing, handling objections).
* Ensure individual development plans are actionable and tied to quota, customer outcomes, and business targets.
* Act as a cultural anchor: setting expectations for grit, discipline, and winning behavior across the team.


 Who you are
   

  

* 3–7+ years of leadership or people-focused experience in sales-driven organizations (SaaS, consulting, or similar).
* Deep understanding of sales culture - the grind, the cold calls, the objections, and the discipline it takes to win.
* Proven ability to align people strategy with revenue performance.
* Strong experience with recruiting and developing sales talent - you know how to spot hunters vs. farmers, A-players vs. tourists.
* Comfortable with both tough conversations (underperformance, exits) and growth conversations (promotions, accelerators).
* Relentlessly performance-oriented, with a clear view of how sales and consulting teams contribute to company goals.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


 Why join us?
   

  

* Play a central role in scaling a high-performance Sales & Consulting organization.
* Free up sales leadership to focus on deals while you ensure the team executes at the highest level.
* Be part of a profitable, fast-moving company where discipline and results matter.
* Shape how we recruit, train, and grow our commercial teams — and directly impact revenue growth.


 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: Senior Lead, Project Manager
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Kyndryl Project Managers oversee the delivery of major projects within scope, schedule, and budget. You’ll be the driving force for every aspect of a program’s success, and the “conductor” who orchestrates everyone’s efforts to make beautiful music together. As the single point of contact to the client, you’ll also be the living embodiment of Kyndryl’s reputation every day.
   

  

 As Project Manager, you have command of a very full and detail-oriented calendar. You’ll be constructing detailed project plans, managing teams, and leading meetings, status calls, and planning and cadence meetings. You will analyze and mitigate risks, manage finances, make sure the team has the right skills, then plan and delegate activity to hit deadlines, deliver on SLAs, and generally delight our clients. Of course, plans often evolve as a project unfolds, so you’ll need to practice continuous structural thinking and take ownership for value delivery, not just task scheduling.
   

  

 But as important as planning and organization are, communication is 90% of the job. You’re the single point of contact with the client, partners, and all stakeholders, supporting them and ensuring they get what they need. You’re also the bridge to every other team on the project, including both technical and account roles. The result is an exciting multicultural, often multilingual environment. Bottom line: You need to like interactions with other people and know how to be kind and empathetic but also assertive — and handle customer change requests with diplomacy.
   

  

 You’re going to be meeting a lot of people, networking, and forging relationships. Our “one team with the customer” concept means you’ll develop especially strong partnerships with the client and elsewhere. Some projects or clients even involve “embedding” with the client at their location. This puts more visibility on you personally, but it also gives you more opportunity to add value to the relationship. This is one of the things Kyndryls love about working here. It’s a great way to hone your service and people skills, and it lays the groundwork for career growth both laterally and vertically.
   

  

 Your future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Becoming a Project Manager at Kyndryl is an excellent gateway to many different paths. You’ll be creating a well-rounded skillset while gaining professional certifications and qualifications. You can evolve horizontally into other technical or non-technical areas such as Technical Service Architect, or you can move vertically to become a senior project manager or program manager. There are many different types and flavors of PM roles, so everyone can find the opportunity that suits them best.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Professional Experience**
 We are specifically looking for candidates with:
   

  

* 5 years plus proven experience developing partnerships with the hyperscalers and distributor landscape in the Nordics, including navigating regional partner ecosystems and driving joint business outcomes.
* Hands-on experience working at a hyperscaler in the Nordics (e.g., Microsoft, AWS, Google Cloud), with a strong understanding of cloud technologies, go-to-market strategies, and regional market dynamics.
* A strong track record in customer-facing roles, demonstrating the ability to build trusted relationships, understand customer needs, and deliver tailored solutions.
* Experience managing vendor relationships and contracts.
* Proven track record of successfully managing complex IT projects or programs, preferably in a services business, with experience working with customers across multiple project phases, industries, and geographies.
* Expertise in cost & scope management, change control, and overall project governance.
* Experience identifying and tracking dependent tasks across projects, mitigating risks, and guiding effective staffing choices.
* Proficiency in establishing program governance, managing interdependencies, and prioritizing assets and resources.
* Knowledge of business intelligence, data analysis, dashboards, and operational reporting.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic agile environment, adapting to changing priorities while remaining outcome-focused.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Senior EPM Solutions Engineer (Pre-Sales)
description:
insightsoftware is a global provider of reporting, analytics, and performance management solutions that unlock the potential of business data and transform the way finance and data teams operate. We empower leaders from over 32,000 organizations to make timely and intelligent decisions. Our comprehensive solutions span Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A), Controllership, and Data and Analytics. We deliver finance teams the insights required to navigate any economic climate and drive greater financial intelligence, while increasing productivity, visibility, accuracy, and compliance. Learn more at insightsoftware.com
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 insightsoftware is seeking a
 **Senior EPM** 
**Solutions Engineer** 
 to join a pre-sales team, reporting to our Director of Solutions Engineering - EMEA. You will handle product demonstrations, pre-sales support and partner enablement for our Channel and Publisher Partners across the Nordics.
   

  





 You will have a strong executive presence and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You will also ideally have a solid understanding of EPM, consisting of Financial Close & Consolidation, FP&A and Dashboaring/BI. Knowledge of Enterprise Resource Management (ERP) systems would be also beneficial .You will be able to understand EPM challenges faced by companies of all sizes and scope today.
   

  





 Responsibilities:
   

  




* Delivering Proof of Concepts as part of the Sales Process
* Present and deliver online and on-site demonstrations
* Become a trusted advisor to customers and prospects


**Qualifications**
* Strong financial consolidation knowledge and experience.
* Strong FP&A knowledge and experience.
* Solid understanding of EPM solutions.
* Strong experience of working in a Pre-sales role or as a Functional Consultant, or Super user
* Must be fluent in English and either Finnish or Swedish
* **Other beneficial technical Skills**
* Understand financial and month-end reporting requirements
* Understanding of various Planning use cases
* **Role Based Competencies**
* Ability to work independently as well as within a team environment
* Be able to communicate effectively with co-workers and customers at all levels


**Additional Information**

  

  





  

  





 \*\*
 **At this time insightsoftware is not able to offer sponsorship to candidates who are not eligible to work in the country where the position is located** 
 . \*\*
   

  




  


 insightsoftware About Us: Hear From Our Team - InsightSoftware (wistia.com)
   

  




  


 Background checks are required for employment with insightsoftware, where permitted by country, state/province.
   

  




  


 At insightsoftware, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

title: Account Executive, Expansion, SMB | Nordics
description:
**Who We Are Is What We Do.**
 Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.
   

  

 Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.
   

  

**Why should you be part of our success story?**
 As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.
   

  

 Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.
   

  

 Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Deel**
* Communicate with clients to understand their needs and explain product value
* Manage the full sales cycle for renewals, upsell and cross-sell using cross-departmental expertise as primary resources
* Collaborate with internal departments to facilitate client needs fulfilment
* Proactively engage cross-functionally to bring new product development, client engagement and competitive intelligence strategies to the larger team
* Meet or exceed monthly and yearly revenue targets
* Maintain accurate SFDC data: accounts, opportunities, pipeline and forecasts
* Resolving complaints and preventing additional issues by improving processes
* Acting as a client advocate with a focus on improving the buyer experience
* Ability to build rapport and collaborate with others within the company and externally


**Some Key Qualifications**

* A proven track record of developing a greenfield territory and expanding business
